comment: She has the ability to keep class very interested in material. I really enjoyed her lectures. Her quizzes were not bad as long as you read the material, but her test were very hard. She is a hard grader and she cancels class without sending out emails to students. I would most likely not take her again due to the level of difficulty I had on test.

She's a good teacher when it comes to lectures. Class discussion was only boring if you didn't participate. Her quizzes are easy if you read the material. Her test are pretty hard and she doesn't prepare you that well for them. Randomly cancels class sometimes. Great personality, but I probably wouldn't take her again.

A good sign that a class is way too much is when the instructor cannot even keep up with grading the assigned work.  She has these crazily detailed rubrics that are a chore to keep up with.We had to wait forever to see our grades on everything. Semester is over,we still don't have grades on papers we turned in. She overwhelms herself! Overachiever!

this teacher is TERRIBLE. She is an english teacher and says "axe" every time she wants to say "ask" Every assignment we do literally has to do with black rights. There is A TON OF BUSY WORK FOR HOMEWORK. She frequentley doesnt answer emails or questions till a week later. She closes class with a note on door last second. Never tells anyone
I did not enjoy this class at all. It was a lot of work and I felt like I was micromanaged every step of the way. She knows the subject very well and I learned from her. I would not take her again.

High school teacher pretty much. A lot of pointless homework. Does not allow you to expand and be a free thinker about your paper. She is too specific and you have to write her way. I would never recommend this teacher to anyone. Awful,awful. I'm disappointed.

If you take this class, be prepared to do an obscene amount of homework. There are reading assignments every class period, writing assignments and quizzes every week, and in-class weekly writing. The 3 papers are not too bad, but the subject scope is narrow. Come to class; do the work; participate in class, and you will get an A.

be prepared to do ALOT of work -- reading + writing assignments due every class period, quizes every week, three big papers and a group presentation. MUST have the book and MUST go to class. If you do the work you will get an A.. lectures are fairly interesting and easy to understand.. potential to learn alot if you have the time.....
Don't take her if you don't have to.Doesnt elaborate on material as much and she jumps around topics.Shes not consistent on her topics at all,not prepared.Will not return your emails.

Very much a high school teacher. Quizzes constantly and reading aloud in class. Very vague about test content. I consistently found myself ill-prepared because the test contained questions on content she did not disclose. She is very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject though. Not an easy A but overall a good instructor.

Boring. Dull. Inexperienced perhaps. Attendance affects grades and there is always work assigned (high school again). Essay topics are stupid; nothing to write on them. Nice professor willing to help students though. Recommendation: don't take unless you have to.
